column4: How do I uninstall a program that is not part of Synaptic?  Just delete the folder?
Many sources include a "make uninstall" option. Try: sudo make uninstall
That command should be done from the folder of the sources
If all else fails, you can go into the make file and see where everything was installed
take a look at the make file, it tells the system where to put the files. An install is usually just copying compiled files to the system
Look for the "Install" section of the make file
What is the url of the package you compiled?
hold on, I'm looking at the sources now
ok, you compiled it with: make  and you run it with ./gdigi  ?
ok, now this is unusual with sources for an app. since you compiled and are running the binary from the sources folder, you can simply delete the sources filder and the app is gone.
You should also look in your home fodler to see if there are any dot files or folders that have to do with this app
Again, this is unusual practice for compiled apps, you won't be able to get away with this type of uninstall in every app you compile
That's the simplest make file I've ever seen
look at the "Setup" section on this page, it details how to install on Ubuntu: http://desowin.org/gdigi/
Those steps are in the correct order: sudo apt-get, wget, tar, cd, make, run
